to give up/to abandon/to give alms
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: I want to pray to God with my utmost sincere heart and I am willing to sacrifice my life to plead God for rain.
sentences.chinese: 我要用最虔诚的心向天神祷告，愿舍身祈求上天降雨。

sentences.english: A mother will sacrifice her life for her children .
sentences.chinese: 母亲将会舍身救自己的孩子。

sentences.english: Would you give up your life to save the president of your country?
sentences.chinese: 你会舍身救你的国家元首吗？

sentences.english: He died on the cross so that you could have your sins forgiven and have a relationship with God.
sentences.chinese: 他舍身上十字架，赦免你的罪，让你和上帝恢复关系。

sentences.english: Their self-giving pursuits for love set great examples of sermons on human beings.
sentences.chinese: 他们为爱舍身的典范，对世人的教诲和影响既深且巨。

sentences.english: He is willing to sacrifice himself for his pursuit of truth.
sentences.chinese: 为了追求真理，他不惜舍身求法。

sentences.english: Then all their habits throughout innumerable kalpas of past and future, during which they abandon bodies and receive bodies.
sentences.chinese: 如是乃至过去未来，无数劫中，舍身受身一切习气。

sentences.english: Zanshin and sutemi are inextricably linked.
sentences.chinese: 残心和舍身不可分割的联系在一起。

sentences.english: You will understand by that time why Chinese each region did have gives self up to the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 到那时，你就会明白为什么中国各地都有舍身崖了。
